item.title: Team Cherry Announces a Hollow Knight Silksong Special Announcement for Thursday
item.content:encoded:
Developer Team Cherry has announced that it will host a "Special Announcement" for Hollow Knight Silksong this coming Thursday, August 21, 2025, at 7:30am PT / 10:30am ET / 3:30pm BST. It's the first official word from Team Cherry on its highly anticipated title in what feels like forever, and it is likely when we'll learn about the game's release date, if we don't hear about it today during Gamescom ONL 2025, that is.

"The countdown is on! Join us in 48 hours for a special announcement about Hollow Knight: Silksong!," the description of the video, which is set to premiere on YouTube, reads. The studio shared the same message on X (formerly Twitter), so for now it seems like that's all we'll get from them until Thursday.

We've known that Silksong would be playable at Gamescom 2025 for a while now, and with its marketing ties to Xbox and the upcoming ROG Xbox Ally, there's been a lot of speculation that when we officially learn the release date for the new Xbox handheld, we'll also learn the release date for Silksong.

That could still be true, and with the ROG Xbox Ally release date likely going live during Gamescom ONL 2025, Silksong's release date could be part of the ONL news cycle, with this presentation later in the week being a deep-dive into gameplay. At least, that would be the case, if not for Bloomberg's Jason Schreier claiming that the release date is being saved for the Thursday presentation.

We'll see how it all shakes out by the end of today, and if Silksong makes an appearance during the ONL presentation. What's certain, is that we are in the final stretch for Silksong. The wait is almost over, and we'll soon have a lot more official news on the title than we've had in the years since it was first announced.

item.title: Delta Force Is Out Now on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, Includes Exclusive Rewards for Console Players
item.content:encoded:
Delta Force is officially out now for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S consoles, after the release date was confirmed this past June. As part of the console launch celebration, developer Team Jade has debuted a suite of console-exclusive rewards for players jumping in on PlayStation and Xbox.

Delta Force arrives with full crossplay support between consoles and PC, though you can opt out of crossplay if you'd rather not play against PC players.

The shooter runs at 60 FPS on both PS5 and Xbox Series X/S devices, though PS5 Pro players will be able to enjoy the game at unspecified higher frame rates later this year through a forthcoming patch. If you want to get a taste of a higher frame rate for Delta Force on your PS5 Pro now though, a press release for the news recommends you disable vertical sync to unlock the game's frame rate.

Along with the main multiplayer Warfare and Operations game modes, players will also be able to dive into the recently launched Black Hawk Down campaign mode as free DLC for Delta Force.

When Wccftech's Kai Tatsumoto played the campaign earlier this year in a hands-on preview ahead of its release, he called it "a drastic shift in both technology and pacing from the multiplayer experience that players might have to take a moment and recognize that theyâ€™re getting two distinct gameplay experiences in the same package."

Now players on consoles can experience the campaign, and everything else Delta Force has to offer alongside PC players.

item.title: Halo is Coming to PlayStation Through a Helldivers 2 Crossover
item.content:encoded:
Halo is coming to PlayStation, but not in the way you might have been hoping for, at least for now. A new Helldivers 2 warbond as part of the game's arrival on Xbox next week brings the look of Halo: ODST to Super Earth's brave Helldivers across PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

If you showed a gamer from 20 years ago the following trailer, where a Halo-related announcement began with the PlayStation Studios logo, they'd be shocked and awed. But in 2025, with Gears of War: Reloaded set to arrive on PS5 next week, and several previously Xbox-exclusive titles already on PlayStation, it's far less surprising, but no less fun to see for anyone who remembers what the divide between platforms felt like 20 years ago.

The warbond will feature classic Halo weapons like the MA5C Assault Rifle and the M6C/SOCOM Pistol, and the ODST-styled armor set that Halo fans know so well. It'll also feature new capes, armor passive, player banners and a player title.

The warbond will be available the same day that Helldivers 2 arrives on Xbox Series X/S, on August 26, 2025. Which is also the same day that Gears of War: Reloaded will arrive on PlayStation 5.
